roughcut.media.videoeditor

Class EffectColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • roughcut.media.videoeditor.Effect
      • roughcut.media.videoeditor.EffectColor

  • public class EffectColor
extends Effect
    This class allows to apply color effect on a media item.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GRAY
      Change the video frame color to the RGB color value GRAY
      static int GREEN
      Change the video frame color to the RGB color value GREEN
      static int PINK
      Change the video frame color to the RGB color value PINK
      static int TYPE_COLOR
      Change the video frame color to the RGB color value provided
      static int TYPE_FIFTIES
      Make the video look like as if it was recorded in 50's
      static int TYPE_GRADIENT
      Change the video frame color to a gradation from RGB color (at the top of the frame) to black (at the bottom of the frame).
      static int TYPE_NEGATIVE
      Invert the video frame color
      static int TYPE_SEPIA
      Change the video frame color to sepia

      • Fields inherited from class roughcut.media.videoeditor.Effect

        mDurationMs, mStartTimeMs

    • Constructor Detail

      • EffectColor

        public EffectColor(MediaItem mediaItem,
           java.lang.String effectId,
           long startTimeMs,
           long durationMs,
           int type,
           int color)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        mediaItem - The media item owner
        effectId - The effect id
        startTimeMs - The start time relative to the media item to which it is applied
        durationMs - The duration of this effect in milliseconds
        type - type of the effect. type is one of: TYPE_COLOR, TYPE_GRADIENT, TYPE_SEPIA, TYPE_NEGATIVE, TYPE_FIFTIES.
        color - If type is TYPE_COLOR, color is the RGB color as 888. If type is TYPE_GRADIENT, color is the RGB color at the top of the frame. Otherwise, color is ignored

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Get the effect type.
        Returns:
        The effect type

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Get the color if effect type is TYPE_COLOR or TYPE_GRADIENT.
        Returns:
        the color as RGB 888 if type is TYPE_COLOR or TYPE_GRADIENT.
